content.raw:
First - some humor - I had been using relays to change the simulated topics to the same names as the hardware topics.  With the latest simulator my relays were suddnely taking up as much CPU as the simulator.  I browsed the relay code to try and understand what had changed to make them that much less efficient.  There were no obvious changes.  What relay (really) happened - The relays that were added to drcsim to copy the hardware topic names back to the simulated topic names were getting into a tight loop with my relays sending messages back and forth and using all the CPU.  At least it was humorous to me...

1.  atlas_v3_bringup.launch needs to have the stereo processor changed to use the new multisense topics (like atlas_bringup.launch) atlas_v3_bringup.launch doesn't seem like it would need the relays

2.  atlas_sandia_hands_bringup.launch needs changed to relay the old topics to the new since the sandia hands are still publishing the old topics.  It currently relays the new topics to the old topics, but the new topics are not published.

3.  atlas_v3_sandia_hands_bringup.launch needs changed to match atlas_sandia_hands_bringup.launch.

I have attached my changed versions.  Other solutions are possible too.
